{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 13-year-old boy with progressive left leg pain for 2 months. The pain started after being hit in the thigh by a baseball, which caused redness and swelling. The pain has not improved with ibuprofen. Examination shows tenderness along the left mid-femur. Laboratory studies show an elevated leukocyte count and ESR. X-ray shows lytic lesions in the middle third of the femur with surrounding new bone formation. Biopsy shows small round blue cells. Based on these findings, the most likely diagnosis is Ewing sarcoma.", "answer_choice": "C"}
